result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera. Kevin Clancy, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in quarantine, appearance is waived. Case is calendared for a plea hearing, parties are pursuing a global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requested projected plea date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Plea hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court GRANTED the defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 5 SUPERVISION.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail of $500.00.   Court adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Sheriff's Department on 7-13-2022. Case is scheduled for 7-18-2022 for return on warrant/bail hearing in Branch 38. Notice is sent to state and defense. Office of the State Public Defender contacted for appointment of counsel.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows on behalf of Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. Court lowered cash bail to $250.00. Defense request case set for plea and sentencing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson; both appear by video.  Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 38. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision (DISCHARGE) Report; filed.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Defense recently appointed. Case needs a prelimianry hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ( $1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Heather Johnson; filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court as a friend of the court, defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail of $500.00.   Court adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION; Missed Contact) Report.; filed.
Return on warrant on April 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Sheriff's Department on 4-1-2022. Case is scheduled for 4-7-2022 for return on warrant/bail hearing in Branch 38. Notice is sent to state and defense. Office of the State Public Defender contacted for appointment of counsel.
filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter: Laura Salcido is present by video.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed
filed.
All conditions remain the same.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court, defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Return on Warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court reinstates bail of $1000.00.   Court adjourned case, Branch 38.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Court is in receipt of warrant pickup.  Public defenders office and district attorneys office notified of next date by email.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Cuevas in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Fred Svensson. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision ( DISCHARGE) Report; filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Sworn as interpreter:  Sarah Chwaszczewski
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with victims WC-C and SC

Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jessy Omar Rivera-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
